<a href="https://www.imanet.org/cma-certification-lp/chairslide?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_term=morning_brew_newsletter_2020_test_a&utm_content=mb_newsletter_a&utm_campaign=cma_2019-20_campaign&ssopc=1" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="IMA® (Institute of Management Accountants)" style="width:100%;max-width: 90px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="90" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8xMTQvMTU3NjA3NzIzNS0xNTcxOTU0ODI4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0="></a>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Saturday morning. </strong>The Super Bowl is nearly upon us, and it’s once again time to show the world we don’t just send good newsletters but we have also perfected one of the most precise sports prediction algorithms in the Western Hemisphere. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For two weeks, the Brew’s 75 machine learning PhDs have been busy feeding the machine over 9.2 trillion unique data points on the Chiefs and 49ers, from Patrick Mahomes’s passer rating in fifth grade to Kyle Shanahan’s annual sodium intake.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The pick: </strong>*drumroll please*...Chiefs win 30-27. We look forward to everyone congratulating us on Twitter on Sunday. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/31/nikes-vaporfly-sneakers-will-adorn-feet-olympics?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pretty Vaporfly for a Banned Guy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nike's Vaporfly sneaker" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwNTA4OTYxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following the trajectory of every great athlete—years of training, daily Wheaties, and approval from the world governing body for track and field—Nike’s Vaporfly sneakers <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2020/jan/31/world-athletics-seal-approval-controversial-nike-vaporfly-shoes-athletics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will appear at the Tokyo Olympics</a> this summer after all.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> The $250 high-tech shoes were criticized starting in October after one marathoner broke the two-hour barrier and another shattered the women’s world record by 81 seconds (forever in competitive marathoning), both while wearing Vaporflys.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Critics called the Vaporfly advantage “</span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/despite-criticisms-technological-doping-nike-vaporfly-shoes-avoid-global-ban-n1127386?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">technological doping</a></span><span>.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the World Athletics federation <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/31/sports/olympics/nike-vaporfly-shoe-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issued modifications</a> designed to “protect the integrity of the sport” but punted on making an official ruling. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Beginning April 30, shoes looking to get foot time in high-stakes competitions like the Olympics must be available for sale on the open retail market for at least four months.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>World Athletics is also regulating design specs like sole thickness. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means the current Vaporfly model isn’t banned at the elite level, at least for now.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why can't we all just switch to Velcro? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because Vaporfly isn’t your average sneaker (or tennis shoe). It uses a carbon plate designed to literally put a spring in your step. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over the last 13 months, runners wearing Vaporfly shoes have recorded the five fastest marathon times ever.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The number of Adidas-sponsored runners winning major marathons has been chopped in half since the Vaporfly launched.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Nike and its rivals are locked in an arms race to roll out the highest-tech gear for elite athletes and earn screen time at mega-events like the Olympics. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>any brand hoping to top Vaporfly’s promise of a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-athletics-shoe-factbox/factbox-nikes-vaporfly-running-shoes-and-tumbling-records-idUSKBN1ZN0NH?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">4% increase in efficiency</a> before the Tokyo Olympics <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nikes-controversial-vaporfly-shoe-cleared-for-use-at-tokyo-olympics-11580484025?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">better hop to</a>—the games begin July 24.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/31/coronavirus-travel-impacts-canceled-flights-airline-questions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Pacific Crossing Is Getting Lonely
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="This photo shows a large Delta plane flying through a clear, blue sky." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjIwL3RoaXNfcGhvdG9fc2hvd3NfYV9sYXJnZV9kZWx0YV9wbGFuZV9mbHlpbmdfdGhyb3VnaF9hX2NsZWFyX2JsdWVfc2t5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Richard Snyder from San Jose, CA, United States of America, Delta Air Lines B767-300 N130DL, CC BY-SA 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As fears of the coronavirus spread, U.S.-China travel is grinding to a halt. Three major U.S. airlines—United, American, and Delta—are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/31/business/china-flights-suspended.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceling flights</a> between the two countries, and not just for this weekend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>United and American will restart service in late March. But you can’t fly Delta to China until May 1 the earliest. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airline stocks took a hit yesterday, but then again...so did most stocks.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>On Thursday, the State Department issued its highest-level warning—a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/30/politics/coronavirus-alert/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Level 4</a>—advising Americans not to travel to China. Then, pilots and flight attendants asked, “so why are we still traveling to China?” and <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-airlines/pilots-flight-attendants-demand-flights-to-china-stop-as-virus-fear-mounts-worldwide-idUSKBN1ZT33W?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">demanded</a> airlines cancel flights. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Other transportation-related coronavirus news</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The CDC has issued a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/31/cdc-quarantines-wuhan-passengers-in-california-under-federal-order.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarantine</a></span><span> for 195 Americans who were evacuated from Wuhan, China, as a preventative measure. It’s the agency’s first mandatory quarantine order in more than 50 years.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The virus is hammering a global freight industry that relies on China. Shipping rates for the massive ships that carry raw materials have </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-31/capesize-index-sinks-99-95-to-near-zero-as-virus-slams-freight?sref=nXmOg68r&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a></span><span><span> more than 90% since a September peak.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/31/chiefs-vs-niners-taking-backseat-trump-vs-bloomberg?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Politics in Super Bowl Ads? Is Nothing Sacred?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your inner monologue at kickoff: <em>Finally, I can stop pretending to care about Iowa.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your inner monologue at halftime: <em>I wonder who would win in an arm-wrestling match, President Trump or Mike Bloomberg.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tomorrow night, national politics will <a href="https://apnews.com/4f70b65216ded97b13a8c974f90ab587?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take over the Super Bowl</a> thanks to President Trump and Democratic presidential candidate Mike Bloomberg.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The two have spent at least $10 million each on commercials during the Super Bowl, which expects about 100 million viewers (the year’s largest TV audience) when it airs on Fox tomorrow evening.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">30-second spots for this year’s game have sold for <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/president-trump-michael-bloomberg-buy-super-bowl-ads-11580408474?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to $5.6 million</a>, Fox divulged. Pocket change for Trump (net worth: $3.1 billion) and don’t pick it up off the sidewalk change for Bloomberg ($61.5 billion).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Most <em>brands</em> are doing all they can to avoid politics <a href="https://www.boston.com/culture/entertainment/2020/01/30/best-super-bowl-commercials-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in their ads</a> tomorrow night. But with Iowa caucuses the day after the Super Bowl, <em>candidates</em> need all the airtime they can get.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Want to learn more about the business of the Super Bowl?</strong> Check out the most recent episode of our <em>Business Casual</em> podcast with NFL legend Michael Lombardi. Listen: <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Lombardi_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Lombardi_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Lombardi_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ve got the ambition. You’ve got the drive. Now you just need a way into the room. Which room? The one where the decisions are made and the deals are signed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you can’t get in that room through sheer force of will. You need the confidence and expertise to gain entry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s where the <a href="https://www.imanet.org/cma-certification-lp/chairslide?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_term=morning_brew_newsletter_2020_test_a&utm_content=mb_newsletter_a&utm_campaign=cma_2019-20_campaign&ssopc=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CMA® (Certified Management Accountant)</a> credential comes in. Instead of being stuck in the back room, you’ll have the skills to be one of the most valued voices in the boardroom.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Through their tried-and-tested process, you’ll <strong style="color:#000">master the 12 most critical practice areas in business, while earning a certification that is seen as a global benchmark for finance and accounting professionals</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ll basically become a data whisperer, someone who can report the numbers <em>and</em> use them to make an impact. You won’t just see numbers, you’ll see the story behind them. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ready to be in the room <em>and</em> advance your career? </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/31/report-avocado-crime-rise?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Avocados Fell in With the Wrong Crowd
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Avocados" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTY5L2F2b2NhZG9zLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pexels</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know avocados aren’t typically considered a “dangerous” fruit (like peaches). But we’ve got some news...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Avocado crime is on the rise. </strong>Mexican criminal gangs facing a lull in the drug business <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/13a377a0-4352-11ea-abea-0c7a29cd66fe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have turned to avocado theft</a>, the FT reports. Their main target: the dozen trucks an hour leaving Mexico’s avocado belt for the U.S. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Mexican avocado industry is growing at a healthy clip. Sales to the U.S., the largest importer of Mexican avocados, bring in almost $2 billion annually.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Avo demand spikes right before the Super Bowl. The Hass Avocado Board said we’ll consume 153 million pounds of the good fat during tomorrow’s game. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Two weeks ago, Mexican avocado exports to the U.S. had their </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/super-bowl-plans-spur-record-avocado-imports-by-u-s-from-mexico?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best week ever</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Bonus avocado content: </strong>The WSJ explores the rise of “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/super-bowl-means-guacamoleand-a-spike-in-avocado-related-knife-injuries-11580230243?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">avocado-hand</a>,” the act of stabbing or slicing yourself while de-pitting an avocado. More than half of the 50,413 reported avocado-related injuries from 1998–2017 have happened since 2013.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>500 via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pepperoni pizza dip. Barbecue jackfruit sliders. Salted tahini chocolate chip cookies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that we have your attention, we’d like to announce our first-ever <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/31/morning-brews-super-bowl-food-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Super Bowl Recipe Guide</a>. Alex Hickey, a Brew writer who previously brought you Thanksgiving favorites like cranberry gruyere biscuits, is back and better than ever. This time, she’s sharing gameday classics, staples with a twist, and more. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/31/morning-brews-super-bowl-food-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">See the recipe guide here</a>. And if you make anything, let us know how it turns out. Or better yet, share a pic with us on <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter</a> or <a href="https://www.instagram.com/morningbrew/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instagram</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

</table>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing the trajectory of every great athlete—years of training, daily Wheaties, and approval from the world governing body for track and field—Nike’s Vaporfly sneakers \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2020/jan/31/world-athletics-seal-approval-controversial-nike-vaporfly-shoes-athletics?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill appear at the Tokyo Olympics\u003c/a\u003e this summer after all.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e The $250 high-tech shoes were criticized starting in October after one marathoner broke the two-hour barrier and another shattered the women’s world record by 81 seconds (forever in competitive marathoning), both while wearing Vaporflys.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCritics called the Vaporfly advantage “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/consumer/despite-criticisms-technological-doping-nike-vaporfly-shoes-avoid-global-ban-n1127386?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etechnological doping\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the World Athletics federation \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/31/sports/olympics/nike-vaporfly-shoe-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissued modifications\u003c/a\u003e designed to “protect the integrity of the sport” but punted on making an official ruling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeginning April 30, shoes looking to get foot time in high-stakes competitions like the Olympics must be available for sale on the open retail market for at least four months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWorld Athletics is also regulating design specs like sole thickness. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat means the current Vaporfly model isn’t banned at the elite level, at least for now.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy can't we all just switch to Velcro? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause Vaporfly isn’t your average sneaker (or tennis shoe). It uses a carbon plate designed to literally put a spring in your step. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver the last 13 months, runners wearing Vaporfly shoes have recorded the five fastest marathon times ever.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe number of Adidas-sponsored runners winning major marathons has been chopped in half since the Vaporfly launched.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eNike and its rivals are locked in an arms race to roll out the highest-tech gear for elite athletes and earn screen time at mega-events like the Olympics. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eany brand hoping to top Vaporfly’s promise of a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-athletics-shoe-factbox/factbox-nikes-vaporfly-running-shoes-and-tumbling-records-idUSKBN1ZN0NH?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e4% increase in efficiency\u003c/a\u003e before the Tokyo Olympics \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nikes-controversial-vaporfly-shoe-cleared-for-use-at-tokyo-olympics-11580484025?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebetter hop to\u003c/a\u003e—the games begin July 24.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable spread, U.S.-China travel is grinding to a halt. Three major U.S. airlines—United, American, and Delta—are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/31/business/china-flights-suspended.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceling flights\u003c/a\u003e between the two countries, and not just for this weekend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnited and American will restart service in late March. But you can’t fly Delta to China until May 1 the earliest. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirline stocks took a hit yesterday, but then again...so did most stocks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Thursday, the State Department issued its highest-level warning—a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/30/politics/coronavirus-alert/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLevel 4\u003c/a\u003e—advising Americans not to travel to China. Then, pilots and flight attendants asked, “so why are we still traveling to China?” and \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-airlines/pilots-flight-attendants-demand-flights-to-china-stop-as-virus-fear-mounts-worldwide-idUSKBN1ZT33W?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edemanded\u003c/a\u003e airlines cancel flights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOther transportation-related coronavirus news\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe CDC has issued a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/31/cdc-quarantines-wuhan-passengers-in-california-under-federal-order.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equarantine\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for 195 Americans who were evacuated from Wuhan, China, as a preventative measure. It’s the agency’s first mandatory quarantine order in more than 50 years.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe virus is hammering a global freight industry that relies on China. Shipping rates for the massive ships that carry raw materials have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-31/capesize-index-sinks-99-95-to-near-zero-as-virus-slams-freight?sref=nXmOg68r\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e more than 90% since a September peak.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F01%2F31%2Fcoronavirus-travel-impacts-canceled-flights-airline-questions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Instead of being stuck in the back room, you’ll have the skills to be one of the most valued voices in the boardroom.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThrough their tried-and-tested process, you’ll \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003emaster the 12 most critical practice areas in business, while earning a certification that is seen as a global benchmark for finance and accounting professionals\u003c/strong\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou’ll basically become a data whisperer, someone who can report the numbers \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e use them to make an impact. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePexels\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe know avocados aren’t typically considered a “dangerous” fruit (like peaches). But we’ve got some news...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAvocado crime is on the rise. \u003c/strong\u003eMexican criminal gangs facing a lull in the drug business \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/13a377a0-4352-11ea-abea-0c7a29cd66fe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave turned to avocado theft\u003c/a\u003e, the FT reports. Their main target: the dozen trucks an hour leaving Mexico’s avocado belt for the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Mexican avocado industry is growing at a healthy clip. Sales to the U.S., the largest importer of Mexican avocados, bring in almost $2 billion annually.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAvo demand spikes right before the Super Bowl. The Hass Avocado Board said we’ll consume 153 million pounds of the good fat during tomorrow’s game. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTwo weeks ago, Mexican avocado exports to the U.S. had their \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-30/super-bowl-plans-spur-record-avocado-imports-by-u-s-from-mexico?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest week ever\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Bonus avocado content: \u003c/strong\u003eThe WSJ explores the rise of “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/super-bowl-means-guacamoleand-a-spike-in-avocado-related-knife-injuries-11580230243?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eavocado-hand\u003c/a\u003e,” the act of stabbing or slicing yourself while de-pitting an avocado.
